qas.question: How many main geographical sections make up North Carolina?
What section of North carolina makes up 45% of the state?
What is the section in the middle 35% of North Carolina called?
Tha Appalacian mountains and foothills make up a region of what state?
The extreme eastern section of North Carolina is called what?

context: <a3_0>North Carolina<a3_0/> consists of <a0_0>three<a0_0/> main geographic sections: the <a1_0>Atlantic Coastal Plain<a1_0/>, which occupies the eastern 45% of the state; <a2_0>the Piedmont region<a2_0/>, which contains the middle 35%; and the Appalachian Mountains and foothills. The extreme eastern section of the state contains the <a4_0>Outer Banks<a4_0/>, a string of sandy, narrow barrier islands between the Atlantic Ocean and two inland waterways or "sounds": Albemarle Sound in the north and Pamlico Sound in the south. They are the two largest landlocked sounds in the United States.
